results.title: How California’s Bullet Train Went Off the Rails
results.abstract: America’s first experiment with high-speed rail has become a multi-billion-dollar nightmare. Political compromises created a project so expensive that almost no one knows how it can be built as originally envisioned.

media.caption: Construction of the California high-speed rail system is costing about $1.8 million a day, according to projections widely used by engineers and project managers.
media.copyright: Ryan Young for The New York Times

results.title: Hidden in 54 Corpses, a Revelation About Ancient Greece
results.abstract: DNA from a 2,500-year-old battlefield in Sicily reveals that mercenary soldiers were common, if not the Homeric ideal.
org_facet: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences

media.caption: A mass grave of troops from the second Battle of Himera in Sicily in 409 B.C. One-fourth of the combatants are thought to have been mercenaries, compared to two-thirds in the first Battle of Himera seven decades earlier.
